doc.previous: On 15 December 2004, Monarch Scheduled announced that it would open a new base at Birmingham Airport. The base opened in April 2005 with new routes to MÃ¡laga and Tenerife.[44]
doc.after: To operate scheduled services from Manchester, an Airbus A321 was acquired. Monarch became the airport's second-largest passenger airline in 2005 with 1.72m passengers using its services from/to the airport.[45] Monarch's total passenger numbers increased from 4.55m in 2002[46] to 6.5m in 2008.[47]
